Section 13(a) of the Exchange Act. o
                                              
  Item 8.01 Other Events.                     
                                              
On September 9, 2021, Wells Fargo & Company
(the “Company”) issued a news release
announcing it had entered into a consent order
with the Office of the Comptroller of the
Currency (“OCC”) regarding the Company’s loss
mitigation activities. In addition, the
Company announced it had entered into a
separate consent order with the OCC to pay a
$250 million civil money penalty regarding the
Company’s loss mitigation activities and
insufficient progress in addressing
requirements under the Company’s April 2018
consent order with the OCC. Copies of the news
release and each consent order are included as
Exhibits 99.1, 99.2 and 99.3 to this report
and are incorporated by reference into this
Item 8.01.
